title: Bacon Shoyu Tare
steps: Combine all ingredients in a pot.
Bring to a boil to dissolve the salt, sugar, and MSG.
Allow tare to cool, then use it as needed.
notes: In the desire to remove some of the common Japanese ingredients from ramen, this recipe swaps katsuobushi with bacon.
The bacon dashi provides smoke and some fermented tang but does not provide inosinic acid, so some additional MSG can help.
If not used immediately, store in the refrigerator for up to a month.
Add 30 mL of tare per 300 mL soup.
